benchmark_details.name: SummExecEdit
benchmark_details.overview: SummExecEdit is a novel pipeline and benchmark that leverages executable edits to assess models' abilities to detect factual errors in summarization and provide accurate explanations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate large language models on their ability to detect factual inconsistencies and provide explanations for them.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Generating benchmarks with executable edits require availability of ground truth pairs which might not always be the case.

data.source: Generated from large language models using executable prompts.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by researchers based on multiple evaluative criteria.

methodology.calculation: Detection Score is calculated based on the proportion of correct predictions among factually inconsistent summaries.
methodology.interpretation: A higher detection accuracy indicates a model's better ability to identify factual inconsistencies.
methodology.baseline_results: The best model achieves a Detection Accuracy of 73% on the benchmark.
methodology.validation: Manual annotation and error analysis for the generated inconsistencies.
